name: src/hofs/bypassCache.js
bypassCache
description: Add random parameter to url for every request to bypass cache. May helpful to deal with caching issue in IE

name: src/hofs/defaultHeaders.js
addDefaultHeader
description: Dynamically add a default header for every fetch

name: removeDefaultHeader
description: Dynamically remove an added default header

name: defaultHeaders
description: Add HTTP headers to every fetch

name: src/hofs/interceptor.js
interceptor
description:
Manage interceptors - to do something before or after every fetch.
Use this with {@link addBeforeRequestInterceptor} and {@link addAfterResonseInterceptor}

name: addBeforeRequestInterceptor

params.name: interceptor
params.description: callback that will be called before every request

name: addAfterResonseInterceptor

params.name: interceptor
params.description: callback that will be called after every response

name: src/hofs/jsonResponse.js
jsonResponse
description: Implicitly parse response to json. The fetch created by this will resolve an array of [jsonData, statusCode]

params.name: suppressWarning
params.description: If true, no error will be logged when request error or parse JSON fail.

name: src/hofs/logger.js
src/hofs/onErrorRetry.js
onErrorRetry
description:
Creat a fetch which retries when:
+ GET with 5XX error
+ Network error

Before import this, you have to install `rxjs` to your project:
```
npm install rxjs
```

name: src/utils/pipe.js
content:
/**
 * Use this to create your fetch method by pipe multiple higher-order `fetch`es.
 * @see https://medium.com/free-code-camp/pipe-and-compose-in-javascript-5b04004ac937
 * @see https://github.com/rudyhuynh/higher-order-fetch/blob/master/example/src/fetchHelper.js
 * @example
 * import pipe from 'higher-order-fetch/utils/pipe'
 *
 * const doThis = fetch => (...fetchParams) => {
 *  // [do this stuff...]
 *  return fetch(...fetchParams)
 * }
 * const doThat = fetch => async (...fetchParams) => {
 *  const response = await fetch(...fetchParams)
 *  // [do that stuff...]
 *  return response
 * }
 *
 * const fetch = pipe(
 *  doThis,
 *  doThat
 * )(window.fetch)
 *
 * fetch('http://example.com/data').then(response => {...})
 * @param  {...function} fns
 *
 */
const pipe = (...fns) => x => fns.reduce((v, f) => f(v), x);
export default pipe;

name: pipe
description: Use this to create your fetch method by pipe multiple higher-order `fetch`es.

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "higher-order-fetch",
  "version": "0.0.11",
  "description": "Using fetch with composable logic",
  "repository": "https://github.com/rudyhuynh/higher-order-fetch",
  "author": "rudyhuynh",
  "license": "MIT",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "rollup -c",
    "dev": "rollup -c -w",
    "test": "jest",
    "pretest": "npm run build",
    "eslint": "eslint ./src",
    "esdoc": "esdoc",
    "publish-doc": "npm run esdoc && node gh-pages.js"
  },
  "jest": {
    "setupFiles": [
      "./jest/globals.js"
    ],
    "collectCoverageFrom": [
      "src/**/*.*"
    ],
    "collectCoverage": true
  },
  "dependencies": {},
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.2.2",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.2.3",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1.0.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^5.16.0",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "6.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-jest": "^22.7.2",
    "gh-pages": "^2.0.1",
    "rollup": "^1.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-babel": "^4.2.0",
    "rollup-plugin-commonjs": "^9.2.0",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^4.0.0"
  },
  "peerDependencies": {
    "rxjs": "^6.5.2"
  }
}
name: package.json
